definition: four horse military chariot (archaic)/four (archaic)/generic term for history books
to ride/to mount/to make use of/to avail oneself of/to take advantage of/to multiply (math.)/Buddhist sect or creed

sentences.english: Passengers must check in at the airport one hour before plane leaves.
sentences.chinese: 乘客必须在飞机起飞前一小时到机场签票。

sentences.english: The taxi-driver had only three fares this morning.
sentences.chinese: 这个出租汽车司机今天上午只载了三个乘客。

sentences.english: If the car door is pushed aside, ask the locked passengers to close the door.
sentences.chinese: 如轿门已被扒开，让被困乘客关上轿门。

sentences.english: Passengers had rebelled against the hijackers, who had turned the plane toward Washington.
sentences.chinese: 劫机者将飞机掉头飞往华盛顿，乘客们奋起反抗。

sentences.english: Two passengers were hospitalized in critical condition, while injuries to the 11 others were less serious.
sentences.chinese: 两名乘客尚在抢救中，其余11名乘客伤势较轻。

sentences.english: Two passengers were hospitalized in critical condition, while injuries to the 11 others were less serious.
sentences.chinese: 两名乘客尚在抢救中，其余11名乘客伤势较轻。
布里甘加河上渡船过河的乘客。

sentences.english: Next station is Wangjing, please get ready for your arrival.
sentences.chinese: 列车运行前方，是望京站，下车乘客请提前做好准备。

sentences.english: One stewardess stands at the front cabin door to welcome the Passengers aboard.
sentences.chinese: 一位女乘务员站在机舱门口欢迎乘客登机。

sentences.english: We have arrived in Tsuen Wan, please exit from the train, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 本班列车已经抵达荃湾站，请所有乘客落车，多谢。

sentences.english: Beijing West Station is expecting 5.6 million passengers during this Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 北京西站预计春运期间将有560万乘客。

sentences.english: The woman, sprawled on the ground, was seen wailing.
sentences.chinese: 这名女乘客四脚朝天地躺在地上，并在地上打滚哭闹。

sentences.english: The well- drilled crew managed to rescue most of the passengers.
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的机组人员设法营救出了大部分乘客。

sentences.english: Next Station, Hung Hom, interchange station for the West Rail Line.
sentences.chinese: 红磡，乘客可以换乘西铁线。

sentences.english: The robbers delivered all of the passengers on board of their money.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫者劫取车上所有乘客的钱。

sentences.english: Airline personnel collect the spare coins and paper currency from passengers.
sentences.chinese: 航空公司工作人员从乘客那里收集这些硬币和纸币。

definition: attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
